<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/23/dr-fauci-officials-warn-disturbing-surge-coronavirus-cases?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There Can’t Be a Second Wave When the First Isn’t Over
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Two waves crashing on Disney World " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDczL3NlY29uZF93YXZlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Anthony Fauci (remember him?) said yesterday the U.S. was experiencing a “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/23/fauci-says-parts-of-us-are-seeing-a-distrubing-surge-of-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disturbing surge</a>” in new coronavirus cases as business lockdowns ease and chin masks replace face masks as the summer’s hottest look.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fauci and other top health officials were testifying before a House committee, where they reminded lawmakers that COVID-19 remains “the greatest public health crisis our nation and world have confronted in a century.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The latest</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/23/us-7-day-average-of-coronavirus-cases-surges-30percent-from-week-ago.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC tracker</a> of Johns Hopkins data, cases are growing by at least 5% in 26 states across the U.S., particularly in the Sun Belt. Morgan Stanley’s projections show that at the current rate of transmission, the epidemic has a <a href="https://twitter.com/ScottGottliebMD/status/1275419771635404800?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubling time</a> of 52 days.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump has attributed the rise in cases to increased testing. At Saturday’s rally in Tulsa, OK, Trump even said he told his staff to slow the rate of testing to keep the numbers down. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Aides later said he was joking, but yesterday Trump told reporters, “</span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/trump-coronavirus-testing-kidding-8a395c2b-6a6c-4393-ab89-3056fb90b8ca.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">I don’t kid</a></span><span>.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kidding or not, more testing doesn’t fully capture the surge in new cases. FL Gov. Ron DeSantis, who was one of the first to relax business restrictions, said on Saturday that testing <a href="https://www.politico.com/states/florida/story/2020/06/20/desantis-pivots-on-covid-19-surge-says-testing-doesnt-account-for-spike-1293901?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cannot explain</a> the increase in cases in his state, stressing that bars needed to enforce social distancing restrictions. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000">What now? </strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A few states, like Maine and Louisiana, are putting some reopening plans <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/23/world/coronavirus-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on hold</a>. And though the MLB <em>finally</em> said it would move forward with an abbreviated season, team training facilities in Arizona and Florida have been <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/mlb-is-set-to-impose-an-abbreviated-2020-season-11592877049?mod=hp_listc_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> after cases were reported at some locations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney World is still planning on opening next month, while the NBA is prepping for a restart in Orlando in late July. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>State and local officials have said that reinstituting business lockdowns remains the option of last resort—but they’ll do it if necessary.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/23/gaps-major-stock-indexes-grow-historic-distances?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Major Stock Indexes Don’t Hang Out Much Anymore
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nasdaq index " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDc0L25hc2RhcV9pbmRleC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>bfishadow on Flickr, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:NASDAQ_stock_market_display.jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NASDAQ stock market display</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once thick as thieves, the U.S.’ major stock indexes <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-big-u-s-stock-indexes-are-telling-different-stories-11592904600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are forging</a> their own paths, the WSJ reports. The Nasdaq is up almost 13% for the year, while the S&P 500 is down ~3% and the Dow is downer 8.4%. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Nasdaq is the furthest it’s been from the other two Musketeers since 1983. The gap between the S&P and the Dow is the widest it’s been since 2002. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why’d they grow so distant? </strong>Part of the reason is that tech stocks <a href="https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1275161374205845504?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are gangbusters</a>, while many others are busted. The Nasdaq is much more weighted toward those surging tech stocks than the other two, which allowed it to catapult ahead. The infamous FAMGA group of tech giants account for about 40% of the Nasdaq, but only the AM part (Apple and Microsoft) appear in the Dow.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ The more you know: </strong>Most market watchers view the S&P as the broadest and therefore worthiest indicator. It comprises roughly 80% of the available market cap of U.S. stocks.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REGULATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/23/german-regulator-criticized-wirecard-disaster?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wirecard Baffled BaFin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wirecard sign " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDM0L3dpcmVjYXJkLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/websummit/49054670061/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WebSummit 2019</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/websummit/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Web Summit</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wirecard’s meltdown is oozing from the company itself to Germany’s financial referees—particularly BaFin, the country’s top financial regulator. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Roll the tape</strong>: Wirecard, a once-promising German fintech star, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/21/whats-happening-wirecard?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">imploded</a> over the past week after an auditor said it couldn’t seem to find about $2.1 billion that Wirecard claimed to have. It’s now considering undergoing a complete restructuring. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The latest update: Munich prosecutors </span><span><a href="https://www.dw.com/en/former-wirecard-ceo-markus-braun-arrested/a-53905720?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have detained</a></span><span> former CEO Markus Braun on suspicions of cooking the books. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, some are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-22/wirecard-scandal-a-complete-disaster-says-german-regulator?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slinging arrows</a> at BaFin for failing to stop the suspected chicanery. Critics point to a period last year when BaFin temporarily banned shorting Wirecard stock (a popular activity), which the regulator had never done to a specific company before.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BaFin head Felix Hufeld responded Monday that 1) it had to pause shorts after allegations of insider trading at Wirecard emerged and 2) as a tech company, Wirecard wasn’t BaFin’s problem.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Economy Minister Peter Altmaier said he’s worried about Germany’s reputation as a financial Übermensch.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/23/amazon-announces-2b-climate-fund?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon Is Ready to Spend
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Microsoft pledges $1 billion to fund climate innovation, Jeff Bezos has one option: double it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Amazon announced a $2 billion venture fund to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-to-launch-2-billion-venture-capital-fund-to-invest-in-clean-energy-11592910001?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest in clean tech</a> that helps fight climate change. The company will spread investments across industries, from transportation and logistics to food and agriculture.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tip for aspirants: Bezos </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/quora/2018/08/22/jeff-bezos-banned-powerpoint-presentations-at-amazon-meetings-heres-what-replaced-them/#1eebafb43b5f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hates PowerPoints</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> After employees put the pressure on senior leadership last year, Amazon cofounded “The Climate Pledge” and set ambitious goals to be carbon neutral by 2040 and use 100% renewables by 2025. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bezos is also putting his “world’s richest man”-sized wallet to use with the $10 billion Bezos Earth Fund he announced in February. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The messaging could use some work </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because when you deliver about 10 billion items a year...your carbon footprint is about the size of Finland. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon’s CO<sub style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">2</sub> emissions <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-23/amazon-s-carbon-emissions-increased-15-amid-rapid-sales-growth?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased</a> 15% in 2019 to nearly 51.2 million metric tons, the company revealed yesterday. However, Amazon’s benchmark for success, carbon intensity (emissions per dollar of sales), fell 5%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Amazon has a long way to go to hit its ambitious climate goals.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MOBILITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/23/segway-shut-july?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Somehow This Didn't Catch On
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Segway gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3osxY5R1W32HxpE5wY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Segway gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3osxY5R1W32HxpE5wY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If your product’s signature user wears cargo shorts and matching family vacation tees, you might be missing the “it factor." After 20 years of trying to prove otherwise, Segway is finally <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90517971/exclusive-segway-the-most-hyped-invention-since-the-macintosh-to-end-production?partner=feedburner&utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=feedburner+fastcompany&utm_content=feedburner&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">calling it quits</a> this July, Fast Company reports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cue the highlight reel: </strong>When it launched, the two-wheeled scootin’ device was supposed to disrupt urban transport like the car did horse-drawn buggies. Steve Jobs said it was the biggest product since the PC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But at $5,000, no one bit. Inventor Dean Kamen expected up to 100,000 unit sales its first 13 months, but the Segway only sold about 140,000 in its history. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And Segways don't come with training wheels. Some cities </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/3525b9a69569d57dc41a373e82a8f1cd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned</a></span><span> Segways for easily spinning out of control and crashing.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kamen sold Segway in 2009 to investor Jim Heselden, who tragically died months later after driving his Segway off a cliff. It was sold again, then again to Chinese mobility company Ninebot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Segway may be done, but its legacy of angering commuters lives on. Segway’s core IP is central to Ninebot’s dominant e-scooter business.</p>

max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDczL3NlY29uZF93YXZlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDr. Anthony Fauci (remember him?) said yesterday the U.S. was experiencing a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/23/fauci-says-parts-of-us-are-seeing-a-distrubing-surge-of-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisturbing surge\u003c/a\u003e” in new coronavirus cases as business lockdowns ease and chin masks replace face masks as the summer’s hottest look.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFauci and other top health officials were testifying before a House committee, where they reminded lawmakers that COVID-19 remains “the greatest public health crisis our nation and world have confronted in a century.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe latest\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/23/us-7-day-average-of-coronavirus-cases-surges-30percent-from-week-ago.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCNBC tracker\u003c/a\u003e of Johns Hopkins data, cases are growing by at least 5% in 26 states across the U.S., particularly in the Sun Belt. Morgan Stanley’s projections show that at the current rate of transmission, the epidemic has a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ScottGottliebMD/status/1275419771635404800?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubling time\u003c/a\u003e of 52 days.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident Trump has attributed the rise in cases to increased testing. At Saturday’s rally in Tulsa, OK, Trump even said he told his staff to slow the rate of testing to keep the numbers down. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAides later said he was joking, but yesterday Trump told reporters, “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-coronavirus-testing-kidding-8a395c2b-6a6c-4393-ab89-3056fb90b8ca.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eI don’t kid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKidding or not, more testing doesn’t fully capture the surge in new cases. FL Gov. Ron DeSantis, who was one of the first to relax business restrictions, said on Saturday that testing \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/states/florida/story/2020/06/20/desantis-pivots-on-covid-19-surge-says-testing-doesnt-account-for-spike-1293901?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecannot explain\u003c/a\u003e the increase in cases in his state, stressing that bars needed to enforce social distancing restrictions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat now? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA few states, like Maine and Louisiana, are putting some reopening plans \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/23/world/coronavirus-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon hold\u003c/a\u003e. And though the MLB \u003cem\u003efinally\u003c/em\u003e said it would move forward with an abbreviated season, team training facilities in Arizona and Florida have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mlb-is-set-to-impose-an-abbreviated-2020-season-11592877049?mod=hp_listc_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed\u003c/a\u003e after cases were reported at some locations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney World is still planning on opening next month, while the NBA is prepping for a restart in Orlando in late July. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eState and local officials have said that reinstituting business lockdowns remains the option of last resort—but they’ll do it if collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnce thick as thieves, the U.S.’ major stock indexes \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-big-u-s-stock-indexes-are-telling-different-stories-11592904600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare forging\u003c/a\u003e their own paths, the WSJ reports. The Nasdaq is up almost 13% for the year, while the S\u0026P 500 is down ~3% and the Dow is downer 8.4%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Nasdaq is the furthest it’s been from the other two Musketeers since 1983. The gap between the S\u0026P and the Dow is the widest it’s been since 2002. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy’d they grow so distant? \u003c/strong\u003ePart of the reason is that tech stocks \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1275161374205845504?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare gangbusters\u003c/a\u003e, while many others are busted. The Nasdaq is much more weighted toward those surging tech stocks than the other two, which allowed it to catapult ahead. The infamous FAMGA group of tech giants account for about 40% of the Nasdaq, but only the AM part (Apple and Microsoft) appear in the Dow.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ The more you know: \u003c/strong\u003eMost market watchers view the S\u0026P as the broadest and therefore worthiest indicator. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWirecard’s meltdown is oozing from the company itself to Germany’s financial referees—particularly BaFin, the country’s top financial regulator. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRoll the tape\u003c/strong\u003e: Wirecard, a once-promising German fintech star, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/21/whats-happening-wirecard?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimploded\u003c/a\u003e over the past week after an auditor said it couldn’t seem to find about $2.1 billion that Wirecard claimed to have. It’s now considering undergoing a complete restructuring. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe latest update: Munich prosecutors \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.dw.com/en/former-wirecard-ceo-markus-braun-arrested/a-53905720?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave detained\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e former CEO Markus Braun on suspicions of cooking the books. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, some are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-22/wirecard-scandal-a-complete-disaster-says-german-regulator?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslinging arrows\u003c/a\u003e at BaFin for failing to stop the suspected chicanery. Critics point to a period last year when BaFin temporarily banned shorting Wirecard stock (a popular activity), which the regulator had never done to a specific company before.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBaFin head Felix Hufeld responded Monday that 1) it had to pause shorts after allegations of insider trading at Wirecard emerged and 2) as a tech company, Wirecard wasn’t BaFin’s problem.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eEconomy Minister Peter Altmaier said he’s worried about Germany’s reputation as a financial Übermensch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F23%2Fgerman-regulator-criticized-wirecard-disaster\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAmazon Is Ready to Spend\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Microsoft pledges $1 billion to fund climate innovation, Jeff Bezos has one option: double it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Amazon announced a $2 billion venture fund to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-to-launch-2-billion-venture-capital-fund-to-invest-in-clean-energy-11592910001?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvest in clean tech\u003c/a\u003e that helps fight climate change. The company will spread investments across industries, from transportation and logistics to food and agriculture.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTip for aspirants: Bezos \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/quora/2018/08/22/jeff-bezos-banned-powerpoint-presentations-at-amazon-meetings-heres-what-replaced-them/#1eebafb43b5f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehates PowerPoints\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e After employees put the pressure on senior leadership last year, Amazon cofounded “The Climate Pledge” and set ambitious goals to be carbon neutral by 2040 and use 100% renewables by 2025. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBezos is also putting his “world’s richest man”-sized wallet to use with the $10 billion Bezos Earth Fund he announced in February. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe messaging could use some work \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause when you deliver about 10 billion items a year...your carbon footprint is about the size of Finland. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon’s CO\u003csub style=\"display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;\"\u003e2\u003c/sub\u003e emissions \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-23/amazon-s-carbon-emissions-increased-15-amid-rapid-sales-growth?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased\u003c/a\u003e 15% in 2019 to nearly 51.2 million metric tons, the company revealed yesterday. However, Amazon’s benchmark for success, carbon intensity (emissions per dollar of sales), fell 5%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon has a long way to go to hit its ambitious climate goals.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F23%2Famazon-announces-2b-climate-fund\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/3osxY5R1W32HxpE5wY/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf your product’s signature user wears cargo shorts and matching family vacation tees, you might be missing the “it factor.\" After 20 years of trying to prove otherwise, Segway is finally \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90517971/exclusive-segway-the-most-hyped-invention-since-the-macintosh-to-end-production?partner=feedburner\u0026utm_source=feedly\u0026utm_medium=feed\u0026utm_campaign=feedburner+fastcompany\u0026utm_content=feedburner\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecalling it quits\u003c/a\u003e this July, Fast Company reports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCue the highlight reel: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen it launched, the two-wheeled scootin’ device was supposed to disrupt urban transport like the car did horse-drawn buggies. Steve Jobs said it was the biggest product since the PC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut at $5,000, no one bit. Inventor Dean Kamen expected up to 100,000 unit sales its first 13 months, but the Segway only sold about 140,000 in its history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd Segways don't come with training wheels. Some cities \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/3525b9a69569d57dc41a373e82a8f1cd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Segways for easily spinning out of control and crashing.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKamen sold Segway in 2009 to investor Jim Heselden, who tragically died months later after driving his Segway off a cliff. It was sold again, then again to Chinese mobility company Ninebot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSegway may be done, but its legacy of angering commuters lives on.
